message: "They believe they brought it upon themselves, that they bear the guilt for where they're at and that the shame associated with it is something they don't ever want their family or anyone that's close to them to know about, so they try to hide it," Sheriff Allard explains."

data.description: Human trafficking is now a multi-billion dollar crime industry across the globe. The crime is happening right here in the Southern Tier, too. In a special report, WENY's Isabel Garcia investigates ...
data.title: SPECIAL REPORT: Trafficking in the Tiers
